prompt: <description>Part 1 - Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Slightly Tapered Top Step 1: Create a 2D Sketch Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Draw the first face (face\\_1) of the prism: 1. Create a loop (loop\\_1) with 4 lines. 2. The first line (line\\_1) starts at [0.0, 0.0] and ends at [0.4453, 0.0]. 3. The second line (line\\_2) starts at [0.4453, 0.0] and ends at [0.4453, 0.75]. 4. The third line (line\\_3) starts at [0.4453, 0.75] and ends at [0.0, 0.75]. 5. The fourth line (line\\_4) starts at [0.0, 0.75] and ends at [0.0, 0.0]. Create the second face (face\\_2) of the prism, a duplicate of the first face: 1. Create a loop (loop\\_1) with 4 lines. 2. The first line (line\\_1) starts at [0.0, 0.0] and ends at [0.4453, 0.0]. 3. The second line (line\\_2) starts at [0.4453, 0.0] and ends at [0.4453, 0.75]. 4. The third line (line\\_3) starts at [0.4453, 0.75] and ends at [0.0, 0.75]. 5. The fourth line (line\\_4) starts at [0.0, 0.75] and ends at [0.0, 0.0]. Step 2: Scale the Sketch Scale the sketch using the sketch\\_scale factor of 0.75. Step 3: Transform the Sketch into a 3D Sketch Now, prepare to transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles and translation vector. In this case, the euler angles and translation vector are both zero, resulting in no rotation or translation. Step 4: Extrude the Sketch Finally, extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model of the part: 1. Extrude the sketch along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.0094. 2. Extrude the sketch at the opposite direction of the normal with an extrusion depth of 0.0. 3. Set the sketch scaling parameter for the current operation as 0.75. 4. Create a `New Body Feature` to integrate this part with any preceding CAD models. The final shape of this part will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top, with a length of 0.75, width of 0.75, and height of 0.0094.</description>
